Looking back and forth between Grandma and the money, Sang-woo passes by a store that sells batteries... but keeps walking. Batteries Grandma checks inside the bus to see if she recognizes anyone. "Is this not the right one?" The truth is—Grandma can't read. "Yes, this is the one. Go ahead and get on." "Someone asked me how you're doing. You should go see them sometime." Grandma plans to visit her old friend who runs a small shop. Meanwhile, Sang-woo is a little distracted by a local girl. "She keeps asking what I want to eat..." "Choco Pie." Grandma picks up a Choco Pie wrapper and heads to her friend's place. "You're here?" "Your knees? Same as always." "So your grandson's come, huh?" "Choco Pie?" "Two of them?" "Here, take one more. Of course." "Leave it." "Hey, leave the veggies too." "Oh no, please. We'll enjoy them." "My knees hurt too much to go out." "Let's meet again before I die." "It's called 'Rabid Rabbit' or something." Sang-woo takes the Choco Pies from Grandma and heads to the back of the bus. "Don't worry, Grandma. I'll make sure we get off together." But Grandma doesn't get on. She asks Sang-woo to take their things. "Isn't Sang-woo's grandma getting on?" "She said she'll finish her errands and come later. Told us to go ahead."
